name: absorptivity
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the ability of a material or surface to absorb (= to take in and hold) a liquid or other substance, or to take in and hold heat or energy: The study looked at the thermal absorptivity of nanoporous materials. The new coating creates a surface with excellent absorptivity.
the ability of a substance to be absorbed (= taken in and held or used), for example by the skin or the body: They measured the absorptivity of three different moisturizing creams. The study looks at the factors affecting the absorptivity of nutrients.
More examplesFewer examplesLonger-wavelength radiation would have a higher absorptivity and would be absorbed in the outer layers 0f the sample.Because absorbance is a dimensionless quality, the units used to express absorptivity depend on the other parameters relevant to the measurement.The reformulated ointment has improved absorptivity of its active ingredient.
